records.location_details: Migrant boat in distress south of Lesvos in Greek territorial waters, near coordinates 38.887833, 26.446500. Later identified off the coast of İzmir's Karaburun district after rescue by Turkish Coast Guard. Also mentioned as 'deep inside Greek waters, southeast of Plomari, Lesvos south' and 'Lesvos island inside Turkish TTW'.
records.where_clear: South of Lesvos island, Aegean Sea
records.location_text_raw: south of Lesvos in Greek territorial waters, additional coordinates (38.887833, 26.446500), off the coast of İzmir's Karaburun district, Lesvos island inside Turkish TTW, in pos 38° 48' 00" N 026° 26' 18" E, Lesvos island inside Turkish TTW, in pos 38° 46' 24" N, 026° 26' 18" E, deep inside Greek waters, southeast of Plomari, Lesvos south, 8.35 km distance from the shoreline of Lesvos, in the area Lesvos
records.context_note: Migrant boat in distress with approximately 50 migrants on board. Allegedly towed to Turkish waters by Hellenic Coast Guard, engine destroyed, and phones confiscated. A Frontex vessel (Bulgarian asset) was confirmed to be in the vicinity. Migrants were eventually rescued by the Turkish Coast Guard.
records.evidence_quote: On 19/02/2024, the Fundamental Rights Office received information from an NGO about a migrant boat in distress south of Lesvos along with videos taken by the migrants. The videos showed a blue patrol vessel in the vicinity and a seemingly black inflatable boat with two persons on board close to the migrant boat. The Fundamental Rights Office identified the migrant group in photographs taken during a rescue by the Turkish Coast Guard on 19/02/2024.
